body.p: To verify A10 Networks LBaaS integration with Helion OpenStack, you will create two subnets, one externally-accessible public network, and one internal private network. The networks should be connected with a Neutron router. The test instances and loadbalancer VIP will be created on the private subnet, and the VIP will be accessed from the public network using floating IP.
To very integration, complete all items in the following checklist:

row.entry:
Create networks and subnets
Create public networks
Create private networks
Create a router connecting these networks

Boot at least 2 instances on a private subnet running a simple web server
Define appropriate security groups allowing ICMP, SSH, and HTTP traffic
Configure each web server so that its output easily identifies which instance it is running on
Use the curl command to verify that the web servers can transfer data between them
Create a VIP on the private subnet
Create Members for each web server instance
Create a floating IP on the public network and associate it with the VIP
Log into the A10 device dashboard and observe that appropriate objects have been created on the device

Boot an instance on the public networka. Log into this instance and:
Use curl to query the floating IP associated with the VIP
Configure each web server so that the output easily identifies which instance it is running on
Repeated queries of the VIP FIP should show load balancing between the members
